question:
Consider the following statements about the term Compact with Africa (CWA), which was recently in news:
  1. It is an initiative under the Asia-Africa Growth Corridor (AAGC)
  2. It aims to promote Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) in African countries
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: <u>First statement is incorrect</u> because Compact with Africa (CWA) is an initiative by G-20 that was launched during the twelfth Group of Twenty (G20) meeting held on 7-8 July, at Hamburg in Germany. <u>Second statement is correct</u>. The Compact with Africa (CWA) initiative aims to promote investment in African countries, especially in terms of infrastructure development. It sets structured partnership between volunteering African countries and the G-20 with the inclusion of key multilateral and bilateral partners which include private sector as well as public sector units.
